title: Bangladesh: Unlocking climate finance for enterprises - PreventionWeb
summary: The article discusses a project in Bangladesh assessing climate financing opportunities for Micro, Small, and Medium-Sized Enterprises (MSMEs) in coastal regions affected by climate change. It identifies vulnerabilities of MSMEs and outlines recommendations for enhancing their climate resilience, highlighting the role of women entrepreneurs and emphasizing sustainable practices. The project aims to foster partnerships and raise awareness for investment in climate-resilient businesses, ultimately supporting local economies. Key sectors impacted include agriculture, aquaculture, and handicrafts, with a focus on innovative solutions to mitigate climate risks.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article promotes innovations that enhance climate resilience and sustainability for MSMEs, addressing environmental challenges and supporting sustainable practices.
business_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses improving products and business processes of MSMEs in response to climate vulnerabilities, representing significant changes in their operations.
green_product: TRUE - The focus on jute-based items as sustainable alternatives to plastic emphasizes the development of environmentally friendly products.
green_process: TRUE - The article highlights sustainable practices and operational methods that reduce environmental impacts, such as enhancing aquaculture with climate-resilient species and biodegradable materials.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 112511 - Finfish Fishing; 112512 - Shellfish Fishing; 313230 - Nonwoven Fabric Mills; 311225 - Fats and Oils Refining and Blending
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not engage in greenwashing, as it provides genuine insights and actionable recommendations for enhancing the sustainability and climate resilience of MSMEs without misrepresentation.
